I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Nothing like a traumatic breakup to make you appreciate a movie like this one. The biggest thing to keep in mind about parody movies is that they have to be able to balance both hate and/or love enough so as not looking either stupid with its found humor or labored with its whole being-disgusting

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John England and scripted by Charles K. Fries. Some minor glue on top corner otherwise Excellent.
